verses.verse: Though I speak in the languages of men and angels, yet don't have love, I am become like resonating gong or clashing cymbal.
And though I can predict the future and understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains but don't have love, I am nothing.
And though I give all my possessions to feed the poor, and though I give up my body to be burned, and don't have love, it doesn't profit me any.
Love is very patient and kind; love doesn't envy; love doesn't brag about itself, is not haughty,
doesn't behave improperly, doesn't insist on her own way; love isn't easily aggravated, doesn't consider the evil,
doesn't rejoice in injustice, but rejoices in the truth,
bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.
Love never ends, but whether prophecies, they will cease; whether languages, they will come to an end; whether knowledge, it will vanish.
For we know in part and prophesy in part.
But when that which is complete and whole comes, then that which is in part will be done away.
When I was a child, I talked like a child; I understood like a child; I thought like a child, but when I became a man, I put away these childish ways.
For now we see in a mirror a blurred image but then face-to-face; now I know in part but then I will know even as I am known also.
So now faith, hope, and love remain, these three, but the greatest of these is love.
